image.altText: Borroloola residents on board a Hercules aircraft at Borroloola airport.

props.synopsis: Three more evacuation flights out of the inundated town of Borroloola are scheduled for Thursday afternoon after more than 100 people were airlifted from the remote community overnight in the wake of heavy rains associated with ex-Tropical Cyclone Megan.

title.children: ADF continues evacuations of Borroloola residents as McArthur River nears record flood peak

image.altText: a male politician wearing a suit and tie with an indigenous print

props.synopsis: Country Liberal Party Member for Barkly Steve Edgington has resigned as shadow minister for the prevention of domestic, family and sexual violence.

title.children: Steve Edgington resigns as NT's shadow DV minister following reports of business ties, staffer suspension

image.altText: The tailings storage facility, also known as water dam, at ERA's Ranger Uranium Mine.

props.synopsis: Mining company ERA wants to extend its lease on Jabiluka — one of the world's largest uranium deposits — but Mirarr traditional owners are fiercely opposed to the plan.

title.children: Company applies to extend NT uranium mine lease against traditional owners' request

image.altText: A CCTV still showing the inside of a supermarket.

props.synopsis: A community advocate and the boss of an organisation that runs supermarkets in Alice Springs says an altercation at a liquor outlet shows that a change to policing at the stores is leading to an increase in violence.

title.children: Alice Springs residents vent fury at government after bottle shop blow-up

image.altText: A bunch of Australian bank notes.

props.synopsis: By tracking this suite of labour market indicators, we'll have an idea of how the Albanese government's full employment ambitions are going, writes Gareth Hutchens.

title.children: Why the government wants you to be thinking beyond the headline unemployment rate

image.altText: Man and woman smile and look at camera.

props.synopsis: The rare snake bite death of a Townsville dad has highlighted a retired catcher's concerns about the risks of untrained handlers trying to relocate the venomous reptiles.

title.children: Father killed by snake bite at childcare centre was 'doing his very best to keep the children safe'

image.altText: a man in a white hat and glasses standing in front of a green garden.

props.synopsis: The peak lobby group for the Northern Territory's cattle industry has elected Henry Burke as its new president.

title.children: He started as a ringer in 1980, now Henry Burke is NT Cattlemen’s Association president

image.altText: Penny Wong looks up in the Senate

props.synopsis: This week Don Farrell found himself in a "bit of trouble", Kevin Rudd tried dodging a Trump-sized iceberg, deadly political consequences loomed amid a debate on religion and the Liberals's woman problem returned with a vengeance, writes Brett Worthington.

title.children: Honeymoon's over for Penny Wong, literally, as a Trump-sized iceberg threatens the HMAS Albanese

image.altText: Black and white image of a tall man in a suit

props.synopsis: Former NBL player Tiny Pinder is sentenced to eight years' jail and will likely be deported over two violent sexual assaults.

title.children: Disgraced basketballer Tiny Pinder sentenced to eight years' jail, visa cancelled over sexual assaults

image.altText: Signage inside the Corruption and Crime Commission office in Perth, white text on black background with WA coat of arms

props.synopsis: An investigation into Western Australia's anti-corruption agency finds one of its own officers went "rogue" when she began an intimate relationship with an informant.

title.children: Corruption watchdog officer went 'rogue' and hid intimate relationship with informant, inquiry finds

image.altText: A woman with her head in her hands in front f a glowing sunset

props.synopsis: The majority of Australians have lived through a climate disaster and they are increasingly afraid of having to move away from the place they live due to extreme weather events, a new survey by the Climate Council shows.

title.children: Australians fear moving from where they live due to climate disasters

image.altText: A man with glasses with green plants in the background

props.synopsis: James Valentine's first inkling that all was not right happened at a friend's birthday party. Now the ABC presenter has something he needs to tell us.

title.children: Trouble wolfing down a curry was James Valentine's first clue something was wrong. In a few weeks, his oesophagus will be removed

image.altText: The foreign ministers stand in front of Chinese and Australian flags as they shake hands

props.synopsis: An old Chinese idiom perfectly encapsulates the essence of Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi's current visit to Australia, and his priorities reveal Beijing's willingness to re-engage directly with business leaders, writes Bang Xiao.

title.children: Forget about politics, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi is in Australia for business

image.altText: Emeriates airliner in flight

props.synopsis: It's alleged Mohamed Ahmed Omer secretly withdrew sponsorship for his then-wife's partner visa before booking a trip overseas. He allegedly returned with the couple's children, leaving the woman stranded and unable to return to Australia for almost two years.

title.children: Melbourne man on trial for exit trafficking after allegedly leaving wife stranded overseas without passport

image.altText: A Honda SUV on fire on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: A 72-year-old man was struck on his morning walk in the Brisbane suburb of Chermside and later died in hospital.

title.children: Driver in fatal alleged hit-and-run in Brisbane went to work after allegedly setting car alight, police say

image.altText: 4 white babies on a white bed sheet. They are each wearing differently coloured pastel onesies.

props.synopsis: Parents of triplets and quadruplets say they're struggling to make ends meet, calling on the federal government to expand support for families of multiples.

title.children: Parents of twins, triplets, quadruplets call for support from government and more paid parental leave

image.altText: A number of people cross an intersection in Brisbane's CBD. Behind them are office buildings.

props.synopsis: The biggest monthly surge in employment outside of the COVID pandemic period has seen the unemployment rate tumble back to levels not seen since September last year.

title.children: Huge jobs gains raise risk of higher interest rates for longer, economists warn

image.altText: A digitally altered image of Kate Middleton and her kids, Louis, George and Charlotte, to have a green and yellow background

props.synopsis: How the royal family has tried to use social media over the years to increase their popularity … and failed spectacularly.

title.children: Do the Royals think they're 'above' the internet?

image.altText: Saline drip

props.synopsis: The girl's parents believed treatment was unrealistic due to her severe epilepsy and development delays, and Autistic Spectrum Disorder, and wanted palliative care instead.

title.children: Despite parents' wishes, NSW court orders life-saving cancer treatment to teenager with severe disabilities

image.altText: Photographs of a report pages laying on a table

props.synopsis: An independent report into government spending finds hundreds of millions of dollars were allocated to sporting and community projects without any evidence of them being rigorously assessed.

title.children: WA Labor promised $298 million to local sports projects. A new audit has found only $36m was justified

image.altText: A man at a workbench cuts a piece of engineered stone. He wears a full head covering.

props.synopsis: Builders and suppliers of engineered stone say their industries are crippled by confusion and a lack of detail from government about the impending ban on engineered stone.

title.children: Upcoming ban on engineered stone creates confusion as 'nobody knows what they're allowed to do'

image.altText: A woman with red hair looks dejected.

props.synopsis: The health minister introduced legislation that bans the importation, manufacture, supply, and commercial possession of disposable single-use and non-therapeutic vapes unless they are used for legitimate health reasons — as it happened.

title.children: Pauline Hanson returns to 'swamped by Asians' comments in parliamentary speech — as it happened

image.altText: the exterior of a white apartment building

props.synopsis: One of the country's most high-profile strata management firms has been "preying on people's ignorance" to hit apartment owners with exorbitant fees, ABC Investigations finds.

title.children: 'Preying on people's ignorance': Strata firm caught charging excessive fees to home owners

image.altText: An image of people queuing at Brisbane City Council eleciton

props.synopsis: Queensland's electoral commission is under scrutiny after ballot paper shortages left some people unable to vote at last weekend's council elections.

title.children: Queensland MP slams 'outrageous' process after voters denied chance to vote

image.altText: A smiling blond woman

props.synopsis: A fresh search in the case of missing woman Samantha Murphy has been wound up, after efforts to find any trace of the 51-year-old again proved unsuccessful.

title.children: Search for Ballarat woman Samantha Murphy wraps up for day

image.altText: Two men in a composite photo.

props.synopsis: Tensions between Sikhs and Hindus were ratcheting up when Samar Kohli received a call from ASIO officers proposing a meeting.

title.children: As Trudeau publicly accused India of a 'hit', Australian spies were quietly making calls

image.altText: Donald Trump's face pictured against a backdrop of red and white horizonal stripes

props.synopsis: Now he's the Republicans' presumptive presidential nominee, Donald Trump's in full campaign mode, and his comments are proving as divisive as ever. We take a close look at what he's been saying he'll do if he's given another term in the White House.

title.children: 'I am your retribution': This is Trump's vision for America, in his own words

image.altText: A drone picture showing brown and green murky water along the Mullaloo coastline.

props.synopsis: Murky and discoloured water at Mullaloo Beach in Perth's north is being blamed on a faulty piece of equipment used to construct a marina nearby.

title.children: Murky water at a Perth beach is being blamed on faulty equipment, but locals aren’t convinced

image.altText: Three Victoria Police officers in uniform, pictured from behind.

props.synopsis: The latest crime statistics for Victoria show offences by 14 to 17-year-olds rose by 30 per cent last year, driven in part by an increase in teenagers breaking into homes.

title.children: 'Look at me': Victoria's top cop says desire for notoriety is driving an increase in youth crime

image.altText: Close up of Kevin Rudd

props.synopsis: The federal opposition's rush to jump on US presidential hopeful Donald Trump's character assessment of Australia's envoy in Washington could erode his standing in the capital, a former senior diplomat has warned.

title.children: Diplomat's warning not to erode Rudd's standing in Washington after Trump barbs

image.altText: A bald man in his 30s with sunglasses on the top of his head wearing a black t-shirt.

props.synopsis: Authorities confirm the body has been identified as that of 38-year-old Scott Billingham, who has been missing from Mackay since March 8.

title.children: Body of man missing in Queensland for 13 days found

image.altText: A young woman with long hair looks inside a full fridge containing soft drink cans, sauces, eggs, a saucepan and leftover salad.

props.synopsis: There are several factors to consider when determining how regularly you should give your fridge a thorough clean, including what you keep in it, how well it’s running and how well you keep on top of spills and leaks.

title.children: How often to clean your fridge to keep it food-safe
